citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A Goldendoodle id # 9256 has evident hair loss around her lower back and hips and the skin appears dry and flaky. The
licensee has attributed hair loss to hormonal or seasonal allergies and has not communicated the skin condition of this
dog to the AV. The hair loss and skin condition should be communicated to the AV in a timely manner so the veterinarian
can determine next steps to diagnose and treat the animal.
Correct by: April 23, 2024

A section of metal panel under the shift door for one enclosure housing 4 dogs is rusted and in disrepair. This level of
disrepair has created sharp rough edges which could be a hazard to the dogs. This panel must be repaired to keep the
area structurally sound and safe for the dogs.
Correct by: April 25, 2024

Currently the licensee is giving vaccines and parasite prevention according to his broker’s schedule and not the schedule
that is documented in his program of vet care and signed by the attending veterinarian. Additionally, the licensee has not
followed his vet care plan for giving a second dosage of vaccines for puppies retained at the kennel past 12 weeks of age.
The license must follow the agreed upon vaccine and parasite control schedule to assure that the veterinarian has proper
authority in all aspects of veterinary care.
Correct by: April 19, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A Goldendoodle id # 9256 has evident hair loss around her lower back and hips and the skin appears dry and flaky. The 
licensee has attributed hair loss to hormonal or seasonal allergies and has not communicated the skin condition of this 
dog to the AV. The hair loss and skin condition should be communicated to the AV in a timely manner so the veterinarian 
can determine next steps to diagnose and treat the animal.  
Correct by: April 23, 2024 
3.6(a)(2)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
A section of metal panel under the shift door for one enclosure housing 4 dogs is rusted and in disrepair. This level of 
disrepair has created sharp rough edges which could be a hazard to the dogs. This panel must be repaired to keep the 
area structurally sound and safe for the dogs.  
Correct by: April 25, 2024 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Currently the licensee is giving vaccines and parasite prevention according to his broker’s schedule and not the schedule 
that is documented in his program of vet care and signed by the attending veterinarian. Additionally, the licensee has not 
followed his vet care plan for giving a second dosage of vaccines for puppies retained at the kennel past 12 weeks of age.  
 
The license must follow the agreed upon vaccine and parasite control schedule to assure that the veterinarian has proper 
authority in all aspects of veterinary care.  
Correct by: April 19, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
